classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as benzothiazines. These are organic compounds containing a benzene fused to a thiazine ring (a six-membered ring with four carbon atoms, one nitrogen atom and one sulfur atom).

category.category: Serotonergic Drugs Shown to Increase Risk of Serotonin Syndrome

drug-interaction.name: Linezolid
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of serotonin syndrome can be increased when Linezolid is combined with Methylthioninium.

drug-interaction.name: Mirtazapine
drug-interaction.description: Methylthioninium may increase the serotonergic activities of Mirtazapine.

drug-interaction.name: Methylene blue
drug-interaction.description: Methylthioninium may increase the serotonergic activities of Methylene blue.

article.citation: Berman HM, Westbrook J, Feng Z, Gilliland G, Bhat TN, Weissig H, Shindyalov IN, Bourne PE: The Protein Data Bank. Nucleic Acids Res. 2000 Jan 1;28(1):235-42.

polypeptide.name: Acetylcholinesterase
polypeptide.specific-function: Terminates signal transduction at the neuromuscular junction by rapid hydrolysis of the acetylcholine released into the synaptic cleft. Role in neuronal apoptosis.

go-classifier.description: acetylcholine catabolic process in synaptic cleft
negative regulation of synaptic transmission, cholinergic

target.name: Bacterial regulatory protein, TetR family
target.organism: Corynebacterium glutamicum (strain ATCC 13032 / DSM 20300 / JCM 1318 / LMG 3730 / NCIMB 10025)

article.citation: Berman HM, Westbrook J, Feng Z, Gilliland G, Bhat TN, Weissig H, Shindyalov IN, Bourne PE: The Protein Data Bank. Nucleic Acids Res. 2000 Jan 1;28(1):235-42.

polypeptide.name: Transcriptional regulator
polypeptide.organism: Corynebacterium glutamicum (strain ATCC 13032 / DSM 20300 / JCM 1318 / LMG 3730 / NCIMB 10025)

synonyms.synonym: SubName: Bacterial regulatory protein, TetR family
